name: places/ChIJxyIYcj1awokRQ5kLk_DfmgM
formattedAddress: 180 Water St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 180 Water St, New York, NY 10038, USA

originalText.text:
It is impossible to reach anyone for help; from management, the leasing office, and even the doormen as they are beyond rude and unhelpful for no reason. The associates for this building fail to understand that we are the ones paying to stay, not the other way around.

It’s truly shocking that they have not realized that we will decide to not renew our lease and begin taking our money elsewhere. I already regret my decision.

If you are thinking about renting an apartment here, think twice. Or, don’t think about it at all. It’s not worth the everyday frustrations of dealing with them.

*FYI the “concierge” service is useless as well and provide little to no communication when asking for a service. Don’t fall for the marketing.

originalText.text:
Front desk staff is attentive, absolutely wonderful personalities, and very kind/helpful even to guests of tenants. Cannot speak highly enough of the doormen! (Thank you for all of your help.)

Wonderful building - amazing location right next door to almost every sort of convenience shop you could need, quick walking distance to parks and wharf, and lovely amenities.

originalText.text: Be cautious of 180’s rude management. Unprofessional and disorganized. It’s unfortunate because my experience was seemingly pleasant until handling the move-out process. They would not return my emails regarding an official walk-through and then hit me with an invoice for everyday wear and tear of flooring. Their team went with fake wood, which tends to bubble up and split.

originalText.text: Pretty horrible living situation with the management , don’t fix anything and tried to charge me for bad floors until I had proof and my lawyer involved , they need to fire Tommy Reis! Worst worker at metrolofts

text.text: Pretty horrible living situation with the management , don’t fix anything and tried to charge me for bad floors until I had proof and my lawyer involved , they need to fire Tommy Reis! Worst worker at metrolofts

originalText.text:
My husband, myself and young children have lived in building and generally don't have complaints - friendly front door man and building staff with the exception of management.  I echo other's opinions that the only concern they have is renewing leases - they won't address any other concern you have.

While I was home with small children in the middle of the day, a man walked into our apartment telling me that he was told by the leasing office it was available.  When my husband brought this to the attention of the management (with me copied) to ask for both the safety of  my family and make sure it doesn't happen again, the woman told us although I have been living in the building for 5 years and married to the person who holds the lease, she could not speak to me in the email because my name wasn't on the lease.  Is it 2022, or at a point in time when the woman is hushed so they can only speak to the man of the apartment? The email originated from my husband and instead of answering his questions, she said she couldn't respond because I was copied on the email.

When my husband then directly addressed her, she simply said that it was a mistake and that they somehow went into the wrong unit.  She said it was no fault of theirs and they take safety seriously.

My question is, why was an unattended person who does not live in the building left roaming the hallways alone? I should be able to leave my door unlocked for a few minutes in the middle of the day to take out trash with out the fear that strangers will come in, not knocking.  We will won't be renewing our lease.
